info.title: Tsuga Public API
info.description: HTTP API used by Tsuga customers

code.description: Machine readable error code describing what went wrong

message.description: Human readable explanation of the error

statusCode.description: HTTP status code that was returned

graphs.description: Ordered widgets that compose the dashboard

Monitor.title: Monitor

message.description: Message to be displayed if a notification is triggered

tags.description: List of key/value tags applied to the resource

owner.description: Team ID that owns and manages the monitor

dashboardId.description: Identifier of a dashboard related to the monitor

permissions.description: This controls which data the monitor can see

Monitor.description: Monitor allowing to send alerts based on telemetry data

name.description: Display name of the notification rule

teamsFilter.description: Team IDs that narrow down the teams that can receive notifications from this rule

prioritiesFilter.description: Priorities that narrow down the alerts that can trigger a notification

transitionTypesFilter.description: Alert state transitions that can trigger a notification

owner.description: Team ID that owns and manages the rule

tags.description: List of key/value tags applied to the resource

targets.description: Notification targets that can receive notifications when the rule matches

maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages allowed during the rate-limiting window

minutes.description: Length of the rate-limiting window in minutes

renotifyConfig.description: Configuration for repeating notifications over time

renotificationStates.description: Alert states that will trigger a renotification

renotifyIntervalMinutes.description: Minimum number of minutes to wait before renotifying

config.description: Configuration describing how the alert was delivered

Rule.description: Rules to trigger notifications to targets based on alert events

RetentionPolicy.description: Data retention rule for a data source within an environment

type.description: Counts the total number of records
Counts the distinct values of the field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Calculates the average value of the selected field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Finds the largest value of the field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Finds the smallest value of the field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Sums the values of the selected field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Calculates a percentile of the selected field

field.description: Attribute containing the values to aggregate

type.description: Normalizes the metric to events per second
Normalizes the metric to events per minute
Normalizes the metric to events per hour
Calculates the rate of change

`Increase` is designed for cumulative metrics. It computes the increase of cumulative metrics automatically handling counter resets. When used with an aggregation like `sum` it combines all series without requiring an explicit group-by.
Computes a rolling window aggregate

targetAttribute.description: Attribute that will receive the formatted value

formatString.description: Template string used to build the target attribute value

overrideTarget.description: Set to true to overwrite an existing target attribute value (defaults to true)

targetAttribute.description: Attribute that will receive the computed value

formula.description: Mathematical formula evaluated to populate the target attribute

overrideTarget.description: Set to true to overwrite an existing target attribute value (defaults to true)

attributes.description: Mappings that map individual attributes to new targets

originAttribute.description: Attribute name to map to the target attribute

keepOrigin.description: Preserve the source attribute after mapping (defaults to false)

overrideTarget.description: Overwrite the target attribute when it already exists (defaults to true)

targetAttribute.description: Attribute name that will receive the mapped value

attributeName.description: Attribute whose value will determine the log level

type.description: Normalizes values as durations using standard time units

unit.description: Time unit used to present the normalized values

type.description: Normalizes values as data sizes using byte units

unit.description: Data size unit used to present the normalized values

type.description: Normalizes values using a custom unit label

unit.description: Text label describing the custom unit

type.description: Formats values as calendar dates

metric.description: Unit used to measure the bucket width
